author: Bella
text: I used to really love shopping on vestiare, the authentication service always gave me peace of mind and the shipping always so fast, however I don't know why but 3 out of the 4 purchases I have made this year were cancelled/never shipped by the sellers (and all different sellers at different times). I know this is not vestiares fault necessarily, but it has certainly put me off buying from their site moving forward, as I don't like the uncertainty. I think there needs to be more incentive for sellers to actually go through with the purchase/more consequences if they don't as on no other site have I had so many orders cancelled without explanation!  The $20 coupon they give as consolation also expires within a few months so I have never been able to use it.
title: orders often cancelled with little to no explanation

author: Ioanna
text:
Sold a Dior Columbus bag on Vestiaire, which on quality control was assessed as "Very good condition" and not "Never worn" as I had written in the description. Fine by me. The buyer cancelled the sale and the bag was republished by them. 

The bag got sold again after the relisting. However was not shipped(!) After 4 days the bag was RE-RELISTED and they said in the description, its condition is "Good". Just like this. Their support is replying always as if they don't read my messages. 

I will never trust them again with valuable items and I suggest you don't too.

author: Dimi

author: Amc
text:
I first had a bad experience with Vestiaire in 2020 but decided to give them another go. In my view their website is likely fraudulent and should be shut down. They are taking money from buyers and the goods ordered mysteriously disappear - at which point they launch an “investigation” .

You cannot speak to anybody you can only use chat on their website or email where you only get automated responses and no one ever progresses the case. 

I bought a 1000gbp handbag which went “missing” in January . Vestiaire have still not refunded me 

I also sold two items in the last month and both buyers have contacted me directly via the website to ask me if I have posted these as vestiaire have taken their money but now the goods are “missing” 

Luckily I have my Hermes slips as proof 
Now vestiaire is putting the responsibility  on me for the items not being received even though I have proof of postage ! And Of course they are launching another “investigation” for the buyers

Yet again the buyers money has been taken and I have not been paid

This website has falsely brokered these sales and kept the money without supplying the goods- pending “investigation” that never happens . Unless you have hours and hours to spare trying to talk to people on chat you will never get your money back

I am amazed an investigation has not been made as this is likely fraudulent behaviour- and reading all the other reviews clearly I am not the only person so there is plenty of evidence. 

They may not do this on every transaction but my suspicion is they  are relying on enough people not following up through their impossible customer service.

Never use these people 
 
I have now reported this to the government fraud department .
title: Vestiaire : suspected fraudulent website do not use

author: Jeannie Cameron
text: Vestiaire Collective is the worst company I have ever had to deal with.  Each of my last 4 purchases has a problem with shipping and both seller and buyer do not understand why they continue to cancel purchases. When each side of the transaction contacts customer service (via chat or email only ) as there are no real people, there are completely different explanations. The people on these chats have no insight or ability to sort things out and say they will refer to experts who never respond. It is a complete shambles and i have spent hours of time following up to locate parcels or sort matters. VC way to deal with this is to cancel el chat or just leave it while you are trying to work toward a possible explanation. It is so frustrating. One of my sales was cancelled and I don’t know why, but they still have my item!  The shipping labels given to 2 different sellers had the wrong postcode in a different part of U.K. on the labels - it is shocking. These things can happen, but the worst thing is the complete lack of any ability to talk to someone in customer service - and arrogant non helpful people on chat who do nothing but say an expert will contact. It’s truly breathtaking in its incompetence. Such a shame.

author: Chiara
text: Absolutely hideous prices for shipping the item, authentication, fees that you need to give to them to put your items online etc. If you take provision for sale (a high one!), at least cover the shipping costs. What do I get as a seller? You uploading photos online for me and that’s it! What do I get as I buyer? Overpriced items and ridiculous “authentication” that YOU decide which ones to authenticate. What a joke. Not to mention if I have a problem with my order (which is almost always the case!), no one gives you support. You wait and wait and wait until you give up. So in summary, Vestiaire is absolutely overpriced in every possible way, ridiculous fees, shipping and authentication costs but no customer support nor good customer experience provided in return.
